formElement.label: Configuration Name:
formElement.documentation: Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Physical location of the jboss client script:
formElement.documentation: Provide the physical location of the jboss Command Line Interface script, i.e: 'jboss-cli.bat', '/path/to/jboss-cli.sh'. If omitted, script location from configuration will be used.

formElement.label: Path to the application to deploy:
formElement.documentation: Path to the application to deploy. Required in case the deployment doesn't exist in the repository.

formElement.label: Deployment name:
formElement.documentation: Unique name of the deployment. If the file path argument is specified, the name argument is optional with the file name been the default value. If the file path argument isn't specified then the command is supposed to enable an already existing but disabled deployment, and in this case the name argument is required.

formElement.label: Runtime name for deployment:
formElement.documentation: Provide the runtime name for the deployment.

formElement.label: Apply to all servers:
formElement.documentation: Select this option to deploy to all available servers. This indicates that deployment applies to all available server groups. Either server-groups or all-server-groups is required in domain mode. This argument is not applicable in standalone mode and will be ignored.

formElement.label: Server groups to apply:
formElement.documentation: Provide the comma-separated list of server group names the deploy command applies to. Either server-groups or all-server-groups is required in domain mode. This argument is not applicable in standalone mode and will be ignored.

formElement.label: Force deployment:
formElement.documentation: Select this option to force deployment. If the deployment with the specified name already exists, by default, deployment is aborted and a corresponding message is printed. Switch --force (or -f) forces the replacement of the existing deployment with the one specified in the command arguments.
